column5: Got a chance to go fishing with an old friend today.  JP (Diplip) invited us in his boat for the day out on Georgian Bay.  We headed up first thing this morning to do some fall fishing.  The weather was pretty nice down here, but up there, it was a whole different ballgame.  It snowed on and off all day and the wind kept us from the Big Bay  The fall colours were fantastic.        We started off with high hopes, but knew the weather was probably not in our favour.  Here's JP and Paul all ready to roll.    One of the lines went and Paul was right there so he got the first and only fish of the day, this cute little pike      JP getting a laugh at the weather, or one of Paul's jokes    Here comes a doozie!    Good times in the snow (more like ice pellets).      The ride back was brutal.        Someone looking for a meal.    Even though the fish didn't cooperate, it was great to see JP again after quite a few years.  Had a chance to catch up and talk about old times.  Looking forward to seeing you again soon JP.  And thanks for the ride and great company, your JPS works great  :thumb:  Joey

Good friends and fishing...doesn't get a lot better than that Joey!  Well, I suppose warm weather and fish would have been better but you know what I mean!! LOL.  Great report...love the fall colours up there.  Glad the icy stuff stayed up there!  I'm not quite ready to deal with that quite yet.

Great report and pics Joey Too bad the fish weren't out to play but at least you got to spend quality time out with an old friend!!!  Looks like you guys had fun nonetheless. Thanks for sharing Leechman
HAIL THE SIZE OF GOLF BALLS........    ok maybe not but that hail looked nasty.  we had a 10 minute snow fall today but nothing like you!.  hardcore fishermen provail!
That's the type of crap that feels like a million needles. Not much fun.
nice pics of the trees.  I drive up there everyday and appreciate the colours. Sorry about the weather and the lack of fish.
Nice to see you guys out again Joey I hope ya dont bring that weather down here with ya I dont want to break out the floater suit yet
Glad you guys were able to get out. Nice to see JP looking healthy and smiling. That's red cheek weather for sure.
Nice photos Joey. We are heading up to Big Doe next week and the forecast is looking much the same as the weather you had. Thanks for posting. Jim
Sucks about the weather but its always great seeing old friends. JP looks like he is lovin it. I think this is the time of the season he loooks forward to every year.

Excellent report and pics Hosette!!!  The fall colors are beautiful... but that sleet and cold would absolutely kill me right now!!!  It's good to see JP is doing well!... and you and Paul look well too!  That Paul is a Pike magnet eh!  Thanks for taking the time to post those nice pics and report!!!
I love to fish that neck of the woods, Joey, but I don't regret not being able to get out this weekend! Gotta love that ambitious weed rocket in the first pic!
Good God Joey, pay attention! Paul is about half an ass width away from breaking your new rod (that's why he's grinning).
Some great pic's there Jo, looks a typical fall day on the bay. You'll get 'em next time.
